holidays.name: National Frozen Yogurt Day
holidays.description: A delicious day to celebrate the creamy, tangy delight that is frozen yogurt. Cool off and enjoy this healthier alternative to ice cream!
holidays.origin: This day originated in the early 2000s when frozen yogurt shops started booming in the U.S., capitalizing on the health-conscious trends of the time.
holidays.funFact: Frozen yogurt was first popularized in the 1970s but saw a resurgence with probiotic claims in the 2000s.

holidays.name: Waitangi Day (New Zealand)
holidays.description: Commemorating the signing of the Treaty of Waitangi in 1840, considered New Zealand's founding document between Maori chiefs and the British Crown.
holidays.origin: Treaty signed on February 6, 1840, establishing cooperation and a legal framework between indigenous Maori and British settlers.
holidays.funFact: It's also a day of peaceful protest and reflection for many Maori communities, making it both a celebration and a reminder of ongoing issues.
